articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver is partnering with local radio operators to launch a new GMRS repeater on Mount Nebo, expanding emergency communication across Douglas County. This project will bring together repeaters across southern Oregon, keeping communities connected when other systems fail.
articles.title: The Roseburg Receiver Helps Bring New GMRS Repeater and Regional Safety Upgrades to Douglas County

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Winston’s main shopping center is getting a major upgrade. New owner Stipe Properties plans to invest over $1 million in improvements, including solar panels, new paint, flooring, and lighting. Sunrise Enterprises will stay, while new shops like a grocery store, bakery, and urgent care are planned.
articles.title: Big Changes Ahead: Winston Shopping Center Set for Major Transformation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A student was arrested after a video on social media showed a firearm brought onto Yoncalla High School grounds. Authorities say there was no active threat, and Principal Chelsea Ross urged students to report safety concerns, calling communication critical. The investigation remains ongoing.
articles.title: Arrest Made After Firearm Video Surfaces at Yoncalla High School

articles.description: UPDATE: OSP arrested Brandon James Jensen, 41, in connection with a fatal hit-and-run that killed Dustin Rios, 30, on Highway 42 near Winston. Jensen faces charges of failure to perform the duties of a driver and tampering with evidence. The crash happened early Oct. 12, 2025.
